description: The Outlook Mail API lets you read, create, and send messages and attachments, view and respond to event messages, and manage folders that are secured by Azure Active Directory in Office 365.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Get access token

args.name: clientId
args.info: Client id received from Microsoft

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Client secret received from Microsoft

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: Redirect uri for your application

args.name: code
args.info: Code provided by user

blocks.name: getMessages
blocks.description: Get a message collection from the entire mailbox of the signed-in user (including the Deleted Items and Clutter folders).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name, if you're getting messages from a specific folder. Specifying AllItems would return all messages from the entire mailbox

args.name: select
args.info: Specify only those properties you need for best performance: Sender, Subject etc

blocks.name: sendMessage
blocks.description: Send the message supplied in the request body

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: message
args.info: The message to send.

args.name: savetoSentItems
args.info: Indicates whether to save the message in Sent Items. Default is true.

blocks.name: createDraftMessage
blocks.description: Create a draft of a new message.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: message
args.info: The message to create.

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name, if you're getting messages from a specific folder. Specifying AllItems would return all messages from the entire mailbox

blocks.name: sendDraftMessage
blocks.description: Create a draft of a new message.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

blocks.name: getSingleMessage
blocks.description: Get a message by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

blocks.name: replyToSender
blocks.description: Reply to the sender of a message by specifying a comment

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment to include. Can be an empty string.

blocks.name: replyToAllRecipients
blocks.description: Reply to all recipients of a message by specifying a comment

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment to include. Can be an empty string.

blocks.name: createDraftReplyMessage
blocks.description: Create a draft of a reply message to add a comment

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment to include. Can be an empty string.

blocks.name: createDraftReplyAllMessage
blocks.description: Create a draft of a reply-all message to add a comment

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment to include. Can be an empty string.

blocks.name: createForwardMessage
blocks.description: Forward a message by using the Forward method and optionally specifying a comment. The message is then saved in the Sent Items folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment to include. Can be an empty string.

args.name: toRecipients
args.info: Array ot JSON objects of recipients

blocks.name: createDraftForwardMessage
blocks.description: Create a draft of the Forward message to add a comment or recipients in one CreateForward call. You can then update message properties and send the draft.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment to include. Can be an empty string.

args.name: toRecipients
args.info: Array ot JSON objects of recipients

blocks.name: updateMessage
blocks.description: Change writable properties on a draft or existing message. Only the properties that you specify are changed.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: message
args.info: Message properties to update

blocks.name: deleteMessage
blocks.description: Delete a message.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

blocks.name: moveMessage
blocks.description: Move a message to a folder. This creates a new copy of the message in the destination folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: destinationId
args.info: The destination folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name.

blocks.name: copyMessage
blocks.description: Copy a message to a folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: destinationId
args.info: The destination folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name.

blocks.name: updateMessageClassification
blocks.description: Change the InferenceClassification property of the specified message.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id to send.

args.name: inferenceClassification
args.info: Inference classification property of the message

args.name: userId
args.info: The user's email address.

blocks.name: createOverrideForSender
blocks.description: Create an override for a sender identified by an SMTP address. Future messages from that SMTP address will be consistently classified as specified in the override

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: classifyAs
args.info: Specifies how incoming messages from a specific sender should always be classified as.

args.name: senderEmailAddress
args.info: The email address of the sender for whom the override is created.

args.name: userId
args.info: The user's email address.

blocks.name: getAllUserOverrides
blocks.description: Get the overrides that a user has set up to always classify messages from certain senders in specific ways.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: userId
args.info: The user's email address.

blocks.name: updateOverrideForSender
blocks.description: Change the classifyAs field of an override as specified.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: overrideId
args.info: Id of the override

args.name: classifyAs
args.info: Specifies how incoming messages from a specific sender should always be classified as.

args.name: userId
args.info: The user's email address.

blocks.name: deleteSenderOverride
blocks.description: Delete an override specified by its ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: overrideId
args.info: Id of the override

args.name: userId
args.info: The user's email address.

blocks.name: getMailboxSettings
blocks.description: Get the settings for the primary mailbox of the signed-in user. Examples of settings include the user's preferred language and default time zone, and any automatic reply settings.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

blocks.name: getAutoReplySettings
blocks.description: Get the automatic reply settings of the signed-in user's mailbox.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

blocks.name: updateAutoReplySettings
blocks.description: Automatic replies are part of the user's mailbox settings (represented by MailboxSettings). You can enable, configure, or disable automatic replies by updating the corresponding mailbox settings.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: automaticRepliesSetting
args.info: JSON object with new settings

blocks.name: getAttachments
blocks.description: You can get an attachment collection.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id.

args.name: select
args.info: Use $select to specify only those properties you need for best performance.

blocks.name: getSingleAttachment
blocks.description: You can get single attachment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id.

args.name: attachmentId
args.info: The attachement id.

args.name: select
args.info: Use $select to specify only those properties you need for best performance.

blocks.name: createFileAttachment
blocks.description: Add a file attachment to a message.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the attachment.

args.name: contentBytes
args.info: The file to attach

args.name: contentType
args.info: The MIME type of the attachment.

blocks.name: createItemAttachment
blocks.description: Add an item attachment to a message.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the attachment.

args.name: item
args.info: The item to attach.

blocks.name: createReferenceAttachment
blocks.description: Add a reference attachment to a message.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the attachment.

args.name: sourceUrl
args.info: URL to get the attachment content.

args.name: isFolder
args.info: Specifies whether the attachment is a link to a folder. Must set this to true if SourceUrl is a link to a folder.

args.name: isInline
args.info: true if the attachment is an inline attachment; otherwise, false.

args.name: permission
args.info: Specifies the permissions granted for the attachment by the type of provider in providerType.

args.name: previewUrl
args.info: Applies to only a reference attachment of an image - URL to get a preview image.

args.name: providerType
args.info: The type of provider that supports an attachment of this contentType.

args.name: thumbnailUrl
args.info: Applies to only a reference attachment of an image - URL to get a thumbnail image.

args.name: contentType
args.info: The MIME type of the attachment.

blocks.name: deleteAttachments
blocks.description: Delete the specified attachment of a message. The attachment can be a file attachment or item attachment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: messageId
args.info: The message id.

args.name: attachmentId
args.info: The attachement id.

blocks.name: getFolders
blocks.description: Get the folder collection under the root folder of the signed-in user (.../me/MailFolders), or under the specified folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name, if you're getting messages from a specific folder. Specifying AllItems would return all messages from the entire mailbox

blocks.name: synchronizeFolderHierarchy
blocks.description: You can get a flat table of all folders in a mailbox. When you synchronize a mail folder hierarchy, request this category.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: deltaLink
args.info: The token that indicates the last time that the folder hierarchy was synchronized.

blocks.name: synchronizeMessages
blocks.description: You can synchronize your local data store with the messages on the server. Message synchronization is a per-folder operation, for example, you can synchronize all of the messages in your Inbox. To synchronize the messages in a folder hierarchy you need to synchronize each folder individually.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name, if you're getting messages from a specific folder. Specifying AllItems would return all messages from the entire mailbox

args.name: deltaToken
args.info: The token that identifies the last sync request for that folder. It is returned as part of the value for @odata.deltaLink in that previous sync response. Required for the second GET request.

args.name: skipToken
args.info: The token that indicates that there are more messages to download. Required if it is returned as part of the value for @odata.nextLink in the previous sync response.

blocks.name: createFolder
blocks.description: Create a child folder by the name specified in displayName.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name, if you're getting messages from a specific folder. Specifying AllItems would return all messages from the entire mailbox

args.name: displayName
args.info: The display name of the folder.

blocks.name: updateFolder
blocks.description: Change the folder name to that specified in displayName.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name, if you're getting messages from a specific folder. Specifying AllItems would return all messages from the entire mailbox

args.name: displayName
args.info: The display name of the folder.

blocks.name: moveFolder
blocks.description: Move a folder and its contents to another folder

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name, if you're getting messages from a specific folder. Specifying AllItems would return all messages from the entire mailbox

args.name: destinationId
args.info: The destination folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name.

blocks.name: copyFolder
blocks.description: Copy a folder and its contents to another folder

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name, if you're getting messages from a specific folder. Specifying AllItems would return all messages from the entire mailbox

args.name: destinationId
args.info: The destination folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name.

blocks.name: deleteFolder
blocks.description: Delete a folder and its contents

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token received from Outlook Mail

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder ID, or the Inbox, Drafts, SentItems, or DeletedItems well-known folder name, if you're getting messages from a specific folder. Specifying AllItems would return all messages from the entire mailbox
